entry.title: SAP HANA DB replication task, projection mapping
entry.content:
Hi All, 

I have a rather simple Replication task using SDI to retrieve data from ERP Backend as a Virtual table and want to map this to a column table on Hana Cloud. This is working ok.

I'm using the Hana Native artifact  *.hdbreptask GUID to achieve the above and more specific the projection here to do the needed mapping of fields. 

And here is my simple requirement/question.

How to map

  • from a source_date NVARCHAR(8) date - example '19991231' 
  • to  target_date of Date type - example  '1999-12-31'. 

This should be very simple, but I cannot figure out the syntax ðŸ˜ž

What did I try until now.

I tried to use TO_DATE function for this ( example TO_DATA("source_date", 'YYYYMMDDÂ´)), but I cannot get a valid syntax to achieve this..

entry.title: How can I exclude CAP sample data from deployment to production?
entry.content:
Hi,

I have setup a cap application connected to a hana database. We deploy via mta.yaml to cloud foundry.

For local development we want to use sample data, but I want to exclude it from deployment to our uat and production environment. 

We have a spring boot java application and for database deployment use typical node based database deployers.

- name:product-api-db-deployer
  type: hdb
  path: db
  parameters:
    buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
  requires:
    - name: product-api-db
  build-parameters:
    builder: custom
    commands:
      - npm run build

I understand that with cdsrc.json or package.json some environment specific settings can be configured, but I don't know how to exclude our sample data with that.  Also I only want to exclude the sample data, not the schema updates.

We have the standard folder structure for database and sample data:

Cheers!

While weâ€™ve successfully implemented the read (fetch) functionality using the architecture shown below, weâ€™re currently facing challenges with enabling create, update, and delete operations directly on Datasphere tables.

 

 

Weâ€™d really appreciate any guidance, resources, or architectural suggestions that could help us achieve this. If anyone has experience or insights on enabling write operations with Datasphere from BAS, your support would be invaluable!

 

SAP Datasphere SAP Cloud Application Programming Model  SAP Fiori Cloud  

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Question about running Job from Subaccount B to Application in Subaccount A
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a request to run a Job in subaccount B that calls an endpoint from an application in subaccount A in BTP.

Running Jobs within the same subaccount works correctly, but when I try from another subaccount, I get a 401 error with the client ID.

Iâ€™ve read about multitenancy, but from what I understand, in those cases the multitenant application has the Job service bound in the same subaccount.

Is it mandatory to bind the service, or is it possible to support the B â†’ A scenario without the service being bound?

Thanks and regards

SAP Cloud Application Programming Model SAP Job Scheduling service

entry.title: Issue when customizing URLs for UI and SRV in CAP application deployed to Cloud Foundry
entry.content:
Hi CAP team,

Iâ€™m following the CAP bookshop example and successfully deployed the application to Cloud Foundry with both UI (AppRouter) and SRV modules.
Everything works correctly with the default route configuration.

However, after changing the URLs to custom routes for both the UI and SRV modules, the UI no longer loads the data from the SRV.
In the previous (default URLs) configuration, the data was shown correctly.

The data is loaded from a CSV file in the db/data folder.

Custom URLs used:

  • UI: https://cf.bookshop.playground.live.pu.ugw.cloud.sap
  • SRV: https://srv.bookshop.playground.live.pu.ugw.cloud.sap

Steps to reproduce

  1. Clone this repository: https://github.tools.sap/api-gateway/bookshop-mta
  2. Deploy the application to Cloud Foundry with the default MTA configuration - works as expected.
  3. Update mta.yaml to define the custom routes above for both the UI and SRV modules.
  4. Redeploy the app - the UI loads, but data from the SRV is not shown.

Expected behavior
The UI should still display the data from the SRV even when using the custom routes.

Actual behavior
The UI loads, but no data is displayed from the SRV when custom URLs are used.

Additional context

  • The data is static and comes from CSV files in db/data.
  • The issue seems to be related to the destination or routing configuration between AppRouter and SRV.

entry.title: Extending Entitlements for aem-validation-service-plan Across Subaccounts
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We are implementing a CAP service that needs to send and receive events to and from SAP Advanced Event Mesh (AEM). We have followed the configuration steps described in the official SAP documentation:

CAP Plugin for SAP Integration Suite - Advanced Event Mesh

 

In our setup, the CAP service is deployed in a different subaccount from the one where Advanced Event Mesh is provisioned. According to the documentation, the configuration requires a service binding to an instance of SAP Integration Suite (aem-validation-service-plan) to obtain the handshake API endpoint (URI).

However, since the AEM instance exists in a different subaccount, itâ€™s not possible to directly bind the CAP service to this instance.

We would like to clarify:

 

  1. Whether it is possible to extend the entitlements for the subaccount hosting our CAP application to include the aem-validation-service-plan from Advanced Event Mesh.

  2. If such an extension is possible, would there be any additional cost implications associated with enabling this plan in the CAP applicationâ€™s subaccount?

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Best regards,
Oleksii

entry.title: Difference between events 'CREATE' , 'INSERT' custom handlers CAP Node.js
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
Can you please help me with the difference between the events CREATE and INSERT? When should I use each one, and what is the best practice? Also, what is the standard sequence of invocation? Based on my debugging, it appears that whichever event handler is implemented first is the one invoked first.

this.before('CREATE', Properties, async (req) => {
}

this.before('INSERT', Properties, async (req) => {
}

Best regards,
Ramjee Korada

entry.title: SAPUI5 application in Build Workzone with CAP Application as a proxy to the backend returns 403
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have a scenario that seems to be quite common, but I'm failing to find why exactly the integration between the SAPUI5 and a CAP microsservice is not working. In what follows there are some details:

  • I have a CAP application with an approuter that will act as a intermediate between a simple customized table with data of things that relate to a specific customer. In the backend, there is a configuration that maps an user email with the customer that will be used. The backend itself is a OData service exposed through integration suite. This project was created with the CAP template in Business Application Studio. This part is working pretty much fine: i can access the instance of the CAP service with the approuter from a browser
  • I have a SAPUI5 application which has its own lifecycle, so it lives in a separate repository than the CAP microsservice. This application is hosted in SAP Build Workzone, standard edition, and the objective is to forward any request to the backend to the CAP Microssservice as a proxy to the backend that adds the user ID information (i.e., the email of the logged in user) seamlessly to retrieve data in the backend without the user even knowing that this is happening .

The CAP service works like a charm if I call the endpoint from the Browser:

And now, I want to be able to call this same endpoint from my SAPUi5 application that is hosted in SAP Build workzone. I have seen the documentation of Build Workzone  and went through some tutorials, but all of them shows the case when the UI is deployed altogether with the CAP service in the same repository, which unfortunately is not my case. 

I have went through a lot of blog posts and other questions that looked like a similar error was happening, but I had no luck in fixing so far.

 

Here's my understanding:

  • The CAP app has two service instances managed within its mta: gt-customer-portal-access-auth (technical name xsuaa, plan application) and gt-customer-portal-access-auth (technical name destination, plan lite). They are both binded to the approuter and to the CAP generated service, so it looks good
    below is the MTA of the CAP service:
    _schema-version: 3.3.0
    ID: gt-customer-portal-access
    version: 1.0.0
    description: "A simple CAP project."
    parameters:
      enable-parallel-deployments: true
    build-parameters:
      before-all:
        - builder: custom
          commands:
            - npm ci
            - npx cds build --production
    modules:
      - name: gt-customer-portal-access-srv
        type: nodejs
        path: gen/srv
        parameters:
          instances: 1
          buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
        build-parameters:
          builder: npm-ci
        provides:
          - name: srv-api # required by consumers of CAP services (e.g. approuter)
            properties:
              srv-url: ${default-url}
        requires:
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-destination

      - name: gt-customer-portal-access
        type: approuter.nodejs
        path: app/router
        parameters:
          keep-existing-routes: true
          disk-quota: 256M
          memory: 256M
        requires:
          - name: srv-api
            group: destinations
            properties:
              name: srv-api # must be used in xs-app.json as well
              url: ~{srv-url}
              forwardAuthToken: true
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-destination
        provides:
          - name: app-api
            properties:
              app-protocol: ${protocol}
              app-uri: ${default-uri}

    resources:
      - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
        type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
        parameters:
          service: xsuaa
          service-plan: application
          path: ./xs-security.json
          config:
            xsappname: gt-customer-portal-access-gt-br-${space}
            tenant-mode: dedicated
            oauth2-configuration:
              redirect-uris:
                - https://*~{app-api/app-uri}/**
        requires:
          - name: app-api
      - name: gt-customer-portal-access-destination
        type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
        parameters:
          service: destination
          service-plan: lite
    in xs-security.json, I have the following: 
    {
      "xsappname": "gt-customer-portal-access-gt-br-${space}",
      "tenant-mode": "dedicated",
      "oauth2-configuration" : {
        "grant-types" : [
          "authorization_code",
          "password",
          "client_credentials",
          "refresh_token",
          "user_token"
        ]
      },
      "scopes": [
        { "name": "$XSAPPNAME.User", "description": "Default user scope" }
      ],
      "role-templates": [
        {
          "name": "UserRole",
          "description": "Default user role",
          "scope-references": ["$XSAPPNAME.User"]
        }
      ]
    }
    and I have already assigned the UserRole to my User in BTP through a new Role Collection.

    in the approuter, I have the following:

    {
      "routes": [
        {
          "source": "^/(.*)$",
          "target": "$1",
          "destination": "srv-api",
          "csrfProtection": true
        }
      ]
    }
     
  • In my SAPUI5 application, as per some of the documents i've gone through, I should bind the same XSUAA instance that is managed by the CAP Application. So the MTA of the UI5 application is as below (there are some comments as I was trying different approaches to know where exactly the problem could be). Below is the MTA.yaml file of the SAPUI5 app:
    _schema-version: "3.2"
    ID: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    description: Generated by Fiori Tools
    version: 0.0.1
    modules:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-content
    type: com.sap.application.content
    requires:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-service
    parameters:
    content-target: true
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host
    parameters:
    service-key:
    name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host-key
    - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
    parameters:
    service-key:
    name: key
    parameters:
    content:
    instance:
    destinations:
    - Name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin_html_repo_host
    ServiceInstanceName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-html5-service
    ServiceKeyName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host-key
    sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    #09/11/2025 - abaixo acho que deve apontar pro camarada no CF.
    #- Name: gt-customer-portal-access-aut
    #ServiceInstanceName: gt-customer-portal-access-aut
    #ServiceKeyName: ke
    #Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchang
    #sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigi
    # - Name: customer_Brasil_GT_CAP_BE
    # URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-gt-customer-portal-access.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    # ServiceInstanceName:
    # ServiceKeyName:
    # Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # ProxyType: Internet
    # HTML5.DynamicDestination: true
    # sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    # forwardAuthToken: true
    # - Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # Name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin_uaa
    # ServiceInstanceName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-xsuaa-service
    # ServiceKeyName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-uaa-key
    # sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    existing_destinations_policy: update
    build-parameters:
    no-source: true
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-app-content
    type: com.sap.application.content
    path: .
    requires:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host
    parameters:
    content-target: true
    build-parameters:
    build-result: resources
    requires:
    - artifacts:
    - comvendorcustomermaterialorigin.zip
    name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    target-path: resources/
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    type: html5
    path: .
    build-parameters:
    build-result: dist
    builder: custom
    commands:
    - npm install
    - npm run build:cf
    supported-platforms: []
    resources:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-service
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
    config:
    HTML5Runtime_enabled: true
    init_data:
    instance:
    destinations:
    - Authentication: NoAuthentication
    Name: ui5
    ProxyType: Internet
    Type: HTTP
    URL: https://ui5.sap.com
    - Authentication: NoAuthentication #setar a destination aqui nÃ£o seria necessÃ¡rio se vc fizer dirteto no BTP. PorÃ©m, aparentemente Ã© uma boa prÃ¡tica fazer isso a partir
    #do mta
    Name: portal-clientes-credentials
    ProxyType: Internet
    Type: HTTP
    URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-get-user-email-saml.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    #update abaixo: apÃ³s voltar o app no Workzone com 403 - ultima tentativa hoje _ 02:24 08/11/2024
    # - Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # Name: customer_Brasil_GT_CAP_BE
    # URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-gt-customer-portal-access.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    # Type: HTTP
    # ProxyType: Internet
    # forwardAuthToken: true
    # existing_destinations_policy: update
    version: 1.0.0
    service: destination
    service-name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-service
    service-plan: lite
    - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
    type: org.cloudfoundry.existing-service
    # parameters:
    # path: ./xs-security.json
    # service: xsuaa
    # service-name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-xsuaa-service
    # service-plan: application
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
    service: html5-apps-repo
    service-name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-html5-service
    service-plan: app-host
    parameters:
    deploy_mode: html5-repo
    enable-parallel-deployments: true

  • Note that it refers to the same xsuaa service as in gt-customer-portal-access-auth.

The problem is that when I open the app in build Workzone, the medatada call for the service returns 403 forbidden without even reaching the app router (I Believe so as there is no logs in the service instance, so it's a bit odd)

Note that i have added a call to the service "whoami" as a test service that is in the CAP application and it's returning 404, and if i uncomment this part of the MTA and redeploy:

  • # - Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # Name: customer_Brasil_GT_CAP_BE
    # URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-gt-customer-portal-access.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    # Type: HTTP
    # ProxyType: Internet
    # forwardAuthToken: true
    # existing_destinations_policy: update

it also returns 403 now:

I am not sure exactly what needs to be done either in CAP or in the SAPUI5 setup, as it looks like the CAP setup is OK, and most of the documents/blogs says that a destination in BTP level should be enough for the Build workzone approuter to connect to the CAP service. I have this destination setup as below:

Does anyone have gone a similar requirement and managed to make it work? I'm thinking that the approuter generated with my cap app can be the culprit but i'm not sure.

I also checked mostly the capire documents (which always uses the samples of UI5 along with CAP at the same deployment) and the documentation of Build Workzone (mainly https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-standard-edition/sap-build-work-zone-standard-edition/developing-html5-applications-and-extensions?locale=en-US and other related topics), but I still had no luck on making it work. There is also a sample in https://github.com/SAP-samples/cap-sflight but it uses an approuter from the SAPUI5, which I understood that is not the case when deployng the application to SAP Build Workzone, standard edition (looks like it has its own approuter).

Really appreciate any inputs,

Erick Grilo.

entry.title: Fiori Elements Value Help token shows GUID instead of text for custom ValueList (CAP / OData V4)
entry.content: Hi everyone,

entry.title: How to clone a CAP based solution from one HANA Cloud Database to another?
entry.content:
Hello experts,

If you wanted to copy a CAP based solution between environments (e.g. PROD -> TEST) how would you do it?

Let's say you have a CAP based solution running productively and you want to clone that system into a test system. This solution is a stack consisting of 1+ CAP servers instances hosted in Cloud foundry and connected to a SAP HANA Cloud instance. Production and test are completely separate (Different HANA Cloud DBs).

Suppose both the production and test systems already exist and are working, they just have different data. We'd like to wipe the test system and repopulate it with data from the production system.

How do you typically do this? Specifically I'm looking for recommended procedures on how to do this please?

Options

One way that will work is using DB Explorer to export all the data for all the tables and then on the test DB import those files. The problem with this approach is it will require quite a lot of manual clicking, time and possibly slicing of data since it is not possible to export some tables in one go (as they are too large).

DB explorer also has an option for exporting catalog objects, but if I understand correctly, these exports bring data as well as all the scripts to create such objects on a target DB. If they were imported they would create a completely new schema/HDI on the target DB. If this is the case this is definitely not what we want.

Is there any other approach, please?
Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Connection error to CAP MCP servers in BAS with Cline
entry.content:
Hi there

I've attended AD160 hands-on session at TechEd in Berlin which didn't work out too well due to technical issues... meh.

So I tried to play around with the CAP MCP and the Cline extension for ourselves. For that we set up a brand new subaccount with SAB Build Code and AI Core (boosters). But we're facing some issues. What we did and what works so far:

- added Cline extension âœ…
- installed npm packages gobally (@cap-js/mcp-server, @SAP-ux/fiori-mcp-server, @ui5/mcp-server) âœ…
- connected Cline with SAP AI Core (same subaccount) âœ…
- set global rule (with this and this) âœ…

But what doesn't work at all is the connection to the MCP servers from Cline. I have this configuration but Cline says "MCP error -32000: Connection closed" â›”

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "disabled": false,
      "timeout": 60,
      "type": "stdio",
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server@latest"],
      "env": {}
    }
  }
}

When I set up the exact same in VS Code locally (with connection to SAP AI Core) it works quite well. Any ideas what the problem could be?

entry.title: CAP Java Draft: Read-Only Field Not Persisted to Active Entity on Activation
entry.content:
Hi community,

Iâ€™m working with CAP Java and trying to implement soft deletion for items removed from the Object Page table.
When a user deletes an item (Composition Child) in edit mode, I mark the item as logically deleted by setting isDeleted = true.
I achieved this by setting the flag in the @On DraftService.EVENT_DRAFT_CANCEL event handler.

However, when the isDeleted field is annotated with @readonly, @Core.Immutable, or @Common.FieldControl: #ReadOnly, the flag is not transferred to the active entity when the draft is activated.
This issue occurs only in CAP Java â€” the same logic works correctly in CAP Node.js.

Iâ€™ve created a minimal reproducible example on GitHub:

https://github.com/miyasuta/cap-java-draft-composition-delete

Has anyone experienced similar behavior or knows whether this is a known limitation of CAP Java drafts?

entry.title: Use Microsoft Entra Id to Secure CAP Fiori Application
entry.content:
I have an HTML5 application developed using SAP Fiori and CAP for Node.js. An XSUAA instance was created for security, and the application uses the Build Work Zone Managed App Router.

I want users to be able to browse the app even if they donâ€™t have a BTP account. However, if they are part of our Microsoft tenant, they should be able to access and use the site.

Iâ€™m not sure how to achieve this. Any suggestions or resources would be highly appreciated. Thanks.

entry.title: @cap-js/mcp-server - Practical guide to get value on day on
entry.content:
Give your coding assistant instant, projectâ€‘aware knowledge of your CAP model and docs. With @cap-js/mcp-server, the assistant can look up entities, services, fields, and HTTP endpoints from your compiled CDS model and crossâ€‘check official CAP docs, so it proposes the right code and changes in your editor.

Here's where I found this and would like to share with community - https://github.com/cap-js/mcp-server

  • Package: @cap-js/mcp-server
  • Command: cds-mcp
  • Tools: search_model (compiled CDS/CSN), search_docs (local CAP docs embeddings)
  • Works with MCPâ€‘capable assistants in VS Code and other IDEs (e.g., Cline, Copilot Agent Mode, opencode)

Hereâ€™s the short version - just follow these 3 step

  1. Configure your IDE agent to start the server via npx:
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server"],
      "env": {}
    }
  }
}
  1. Add these rules to AGENTS.md so the assistant always uses the server correctly:
- You MUST search for CDS definitions, like entities, fields and services (which include HTTP endpoints) with cds-mcp, only if it fails you MAY read *.cds files in the project.
- You MUST search for CAP docs with cds-mcp EVERY TIME you create, modify CDS models or when using APIs or the `cds` CLI from CAP. Do NOT propose, suggest or make any changes without first checking it.
  1. Optional CLI smoke test:
npm i -g @cap-js/mcp-server
cds-mcp search_model . Books entity
cds-mcp search_docs "how to add columns to a select statement in CAP Node.js" 1

Why youâ€™ll love it

  • Stop guessing: Fuzzyâ€‘search your compiled model for entities, services, elements, annotations, and endpoints.
  • Fewer mistakes: Suggestions are grounded in your actual model and verified against official CAP docs.
  • All local: Fast and private, perfect for dayâ€‘toâ€‘day development.

IDE setup

VS Code - Cline extension

Settings example:

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server"],
      "env": {}
    }
  }
}

VS Code - GitHub Copilot Agent Mode (global mcp.json)

{
  "servers": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": ["-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server"],
      "env": {},
      "type": "stdio"
    },
    "inputs": []
  }
}

opencode

{
  "mcp": {
    "cds-mcp": {
      "type": "local",
      "command": ["npx", "-y", "@cap-js/mcp-server"],
      "enabled": true
    }
  }
}

Tip: Keep the server name â€œcds-mcpâ€ in both your config and prompts so your assistant reliably calls it.

How to use it in your editor

Think â€œdiscover first, then change.â€ Ask your assistant to:

  • Discover model and endpoints

    • â€œUse cdsâ€‘mcp search_model to list all services and their HTTP endpoints. Then list entities with primary keys.â€

  • Write a correct SELECT with expand

    • â€œCall cdsâ€‘mcp search_model for Books and its associations. Then, after checking CAP Node.js SELECT expand syntax via cdsâ€‘mcp search_docs, propose a handler that returns Books.title, Books.stock and expands auther.name.â€

  • Generate precise OData URLs

    • â€œFind the service and endpoint for Books via search_model, then give me an OData V4 URL with $select=title,stock and $expand=author($select=name) plus a curl example.â€

  • Safely change CDS/annotations

    • â€œShow docs for @Common.Label using cdsâ€‘mcp search_docs. Using search_model for Books, propose a minimal diff adding labels for title and stock. Include file paths.â€

  • Plan a refactor

    • â€œWeâ€™re renaming Author to Writer. With cdsâ€‘mcp search_model, list affected entities, associations, services, and endpoints; propose a stepâ€‘byâ€‘step PR plan.â€

  • Implement an action/handler

    • â€œFind docs on defining and implementing a custom action in Node.js via cdsâ€‘mcp search_docs. Then sketch a minimal handler in srv/<service>.js with imports and input validation.â€

Best practice: Ask the assistant to paste the search_model and search_docs results that justify any change.

CLI usage (optional but handy)

Install globally to test from your terminal:

npm i -g @cap-js/mcp-server
  • Search your compiled model:
cds-mcp search_model . Books entity
  • Search CAP documentation:
cds-mcp search_docs "how to add columns to a select statement in CAP Node.js" 1

Once the CLI works, your IDE agent can invoke the same tools automatically.

What the tools return

  • search_model

    • Names and kinds (entity, service, etc.)
    • Elements and annotations
    • File locations
    • HTTP endpoints where services are exposed

  • search_docs

    • The most relevant CAP documentation snippets for your query, based on local embeddings

Use both together: discover exact names/paths with search_model, confirm syntax and best practices with search_docs, then apply small, reviewable changes.

Tips for getting the most value

  • Start every task with search_model to avoid typos and stale assumptions.
  • Require docsâ€‘backed edits: have the assistant run search_docs before proposing code.
  • Keep edits atomic: one focused change at a time, with file paths and minimal diffs.
  • Monorepo? Tell the assistant the CAP project folder to search.

Support and contribution

  • Issues and feature requests: https://github.com/cap-js/mcp-server/issues
  • Security policy: https://github.com/cap-js/mcp-server/security/policy
  • Code of Conduct: https://github.com/cap-js/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
  • License and REUSE info: see LICENSE and https://api.reuse.software/info/github.com/cap-js/mcp-server

Now action - 

  • Add the MCP config, paste the two rules into AGENTS.md, and ask your assistant:
    â€œDiscover all entities, keys, and endpoints with cdsâ€‘mcp search_model, verify the Node.js SELECT docs with cdsâ€‘mcp search_docs, then propose a minimal handler change for Books.â€

    SAP Business Technology Platform  SAP Business AI SAP Cloud Application Programming Model

entry.title: What is the best development pattern or architecture to follow in SAP CAP Node.js projects
entry.content:
Iâ€™m working on a growing SAP CAP (Cloud Application Programming Model) project using Node.js, and the team wants to adopt a consistent development pattern or architecture to keep the codebase clean, maintainable, and scalable.

Iâ€™m familiar with general backend principles like SOLID, but Iâ€™m not sure how well they apply in CAP, since a lot of the database interaction is handled through CDS services, entities, and the frameworkâ€™s built-in handlers.

So my question is:

What is the recommended architectural pattern for CAP Node.js development?
Should we try to follow something like SOLID, or are there CAP-specific or Node-oriented patterns that work better?

Iâ€™d appreciate guidance or examples on patterns such as:

  • Service / Handler separation
  • Domain-Driven Design (DDD)
  • Clean Architecture
  • Repository or Data Mapper patterns (and whether they make sense in CAP, since CDS services already abstract the DB)
  • Modularization strategies for large CAP projects
  • Any best practices from real CAP projects in production

If you have suggestions, examples, or official recommendations from SAP, that would be extremely helpful.
